billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Requires the legislature to convene daily if they do not timely pass a budget
summary: Provides that if the legislature does not timely pass a budget, it shall convene daily until legislative passage of such budget.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1763

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 12, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sens. PERKINS, DUANE, HASSELL-THOMPSON, KRUEGER, PARKER,
         SERRANO -- read twice and ordered printed,  and  when  printed  to  be
         committed to the Committee on Investigations and Government Operations

       AN ACT to amend the legislative law, in relation to requiring the legis-
         lature  to  convene  daily if the legislative passage of the budget is
         not timely

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. The legislative law is amended by adding a new section 5-b
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S 5-B. ABSENT OF BUDGET BY THE NEW FISCAL YEAR, THE LEGISLATURE  SHALL
    4  CONVENE DAILY. IF LEGISLATIVE PASSAGE OF THE BUDGET AS DEFINED IN SUBDI-
    5  VISION  THREE  OF SECTION FIVE OF THIS ARTICLE HAS NOT OCCURRED PRIOR TO
    6  THE FIRST DAY OF ANY FISCAL YEAR, EACH HOUSE OF  THE  LEGISLATURE  SHALL
    7  CONVENE  ON  A  DAILY BASIS UNTIL SUCH LEGISLATIVE PASSAGE OF THE BUDGET
    8  HAS OCCURRED.
    9    S 2. Subdivision 3 of section 5 of the legislative law,  as  added  by
   10  chapter 635 of the laws of 1998, is amended to read as follows:
   11    3.  "Legislative  passage  of  the budget", solely for the purposes of
   12  this section and [section] SECTIONS five-a AND FIVE-B of  this  article,
   13  shall  mean that the appropriation bill or bills submitted by the gover-
   14  nor pursuant to section three of article seven of the state constitution
   15  have been finally acted on by both houses of the legislature in  accord-
   16  ance  with  article  seven of the state constitution and the state comp-
   17  troller has determined that such appropriation bill or bills  that  have
   18  been  finally acted on by the legislature are sufficient for the ongoing
   19  operation and support of state government and local assistance  for  the
   20  ensuing  fiscal year. In addition, legislation submitted by the governor
   21  pursuant to section three of article seven  of  the  state  constitution
   22  determined necessary by the legislature for the effective implementation
   23  of such appropriation bill or bills shall have been acted on. Nothing in
   24  this  section  shall be construed to affect the prohibition contained in
   25  section five of article seven of the state constitution.
   26    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
